court.center: Judicial District of New Haven at New Haven

unpublished.footnote_body: [EDITOR'S NOTE: This case is unpublished as indicated by the issuing court.]

opinion_byline.unpublished: WILLIAM L. HADDEN, JUDGE TRIAL REFEREE.

opinion_text.unpublished:
This case was heard on the hearing in damages calendar on July 19, 2006. The court finds that the defendant is not in the military service.
The plaintiff has proven compensatory damages of $30,880.20, and the court awards punitive damages of $5,000.00. Judgment may enter in the amount of $35,880.20. The plaintiff may tax costs which shall include a title search fee of $150.00.
The request that this court issue a judgment declaring that the quitclaim deed dated February 23, 1999 and recorded in volume 5461 at page 281 of the New Haven land records is null and void, and that the plaintiff is restored to sole ownership of the property described in said deed is granted. Plaintiff's counsel is directed to prepare an appropriate form of judgment, after consultation with the clerk's office. CT Page 13198
